quest.name: Criminal Phrenology
journal: Gyoei of Yuzuka Manor is looking for an adventurer with the constitution to see his deed done.
objectives: Speak with the magatsu koja and defeat any enemies that appear.
Deliver the muddy purse to Gyoei.

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: You're the strongest-looking adventurer I've seen all day! Very sturdy, very solid. I've a deed I'd like to ask of you.

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: Allow me to explain. Some days past, I was walking near the large gate just behind our manor, here. Well, you can imagine my surprise when I came under attack by a massive koja, big and round as a goobbue's belly! I escaped without injury, but the cursed thing made off with my coinpurse.

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: Those contestable koja are always making life hard for us Namazu. Could you go and have words with them? I know of no other way to retrieve my coinpurse. And if they won't return it, you have my leave to be as rough as you like!

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: Could you go and have words with those contestable koja? I know of no other way to retrieve my coinpurse. And if they won't return it, you have my leave to be as rough as you like!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The magatsu koja casts his gaze toward the One River. Perhaps what you seek lies in that direction.

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: Did you punish those koja for what they did? Chastise them, beat them?

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: Well, thank you for that. And you got my coinpurse back! I had nearly given up hope.

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: I pray your words serve to calm them for a spell. We Namazu cannot suffer much more harassment at their...heads.

dialogue.name: GYOEI
dialogue.text: This gil did not come easy. It was born of my labor. Of my sweat and tears. I worked hard, picking flowers. Soaking them and flavoring them. I sell and serve them to the people here, and all who buy them sing their praises. I am grateful for what you did this day.
